title: Full Stack Engineer
desc: Re-engineering key platforms, applications, and microservices at Lumen Technologies, giving customers streamlined orchestration of infrastructure and cloud application management.
Building a custom UI from the ground up with React, Redux, Babel, JSX, HTML, and CSS, using Jest with Enzyme for unit testing and Cucumber/Puppeteer for end-to-end (E2E) testing.
Actively contributing to UX design discussions with complex considerations; conceptualizing and implementing solutions that will best meet the needs of various project stakeholders.
Developing API microservices based in Ruby with Grape and ActiveRecord, utilizing RSpec for test-driven development (TDD).

Improving CI/CD for multiple environments with automated Jenkins pipelines in Groovy; deploying containerized applications with Docker, Helm, and Kubernetes to Google Cloud Platform (GCP) for dynamic scaling.
Enriching and refining shared libraries to improve efficiency and long-term efficacy of code base.
Devising a new solution for remote administration; automating the creation of VPN tunnels with Wireguard, Go, Python, and Bash shell script, leveraging Terraform for infrastructure.
Practicing Agile methodology with daily collaboration of team members and regular code review/testing; utilizing Git workflow with GitHub/Jira integration.

title: Tech Leadership Fellow
desc: Mentoring students in the intensive CoderGirl program (WebDev/FrontEnd track).
Unit 1 covers JavaScript, HTML, CSS, consuming APIs, the DOM, TypeScript, and Angular, including skills in unit testing, git workflow, and more.

Unit 2 takes students on a deep dive into React, focusing on function-based components and hooks and featuring integration of third-party libraries such as styled-components. In previous cohorts we taught Angular with Bootstrap.
The Liftoff course centers on career prep with resume-building, behavioral and technical interview skills, and a capstone project using AGILE methodology.

Designed 60+ original practice problems/projects for students to complement the Unit 1 LaunchCode curriculum and help students prepare for graded assignments. These exercises are also now in use not only in by students in LaunchCode's CoderGirl program, but in the LC101 and CodeCamp programs as well in St. Louis and beyond. Periodically hold in-depth live tutorials; recently guest lectured on technical interviews and live coding.

title: MuleSoft Developer
desc: Participated in an apprenticeship at Cognizant to build middleware solutions for businesses.
Earned the Level 1 Developer certification from MuleSoft after intensive training in Mule 4 ESB.

Gained knowledge in writing detailed RAML specifications; built Mule applications with API interfacing, DataWeave transformations, data validation, encapsulation of global elements, property placeholders, logging, and error handling.
Utilized a wide range of Core, Database, File, HTTP, JMS, Salesforce, and VM connectors to develop flows and subflows, consuming multiple types of web services.
Became familiar with AnyPoint Platform, publishing APIs, creating API proxies, implementing SLA policies and client ID enforcement, and deploying applications to CloudHub.

title: Grant Writer | Database Manager | Graphic Designer
desc: Authored grant proposals and impact reports for both private and corporate foundations.
Streamlined the tracking process, designing an improved file system & master spreadsheet for dynamic use.
Researched new opportunities, tripling the number of proposals in annual rotation within the first year, and doubling the amount awarded compared to the prior year.
Customized a new cloud-based database platform, improving the ability to track both clients and donors, gauge the success of each program and analyze data for grant writing and reporting.
Oversaw transition to new database, documenting internal protocols & procedures and training staff members.
Devised a new system for data collection; simplified reporting for off-site service providers and streamlined data entry for administrative staff.

Created original designs and wrote compelling copy for major donor appeals, fundraising events, press releases, thank-you letters, program marketing materials, and engaging, full-color grant proposals for grant funders without specific format requirements.

title: Administrator | Grant Writer | Graphic Designer
desc: Provided critical support in all administrative areas, directly contributing to the growth of Harambee from a small summer program with a budget of $147,500 to a thriving organization with 24 year-round employees and an annual budget of nearly $1.4M.

Assumed full bookkeeping & accounting responsibilities in 2006; restructured accounts twice in step with rapid organizational growth, streamlining financial reporting and improving the week-to-week cash flow analysis.
Tracked over $1.4M in private contributions and handled participation in the Missouri AHAP tax credit program, bringing in an additional $2M in donations.
Authored over 30 successful grant proposals, resulting in over $1.5M in federal block grant funding and other grants; managed contracts, reimbursement requests, documentation, reporting and audits.

Designed tailored in-house solutions for the collection, management, and reporting of demographic and program-specific data on hundreds of youth participants, homeowner clients, and community service projects.

Crafted visually engaging and well-written newsletters, brochures, and other literature; designed t-shirts; produced customized forms, from client & employee applications to client intake forms, employee time sheets, and various internal documents.
